answers.answer: Different people have different issues with these drugs. Your doctors are the right person to guide you. Someone from our forum might answer your specific question.

I've been taking cialis for a month and haven't really noticed any side effects. If you really don't wanna try it then you can try kegels or some supps like L Arginine. Arginine helps blood flow which is probably the case with an over weight diabetic

question: I'm type 2 diabetic and overweight and have not had any erection problems until this year when during foreplay I'd be as hard as a rock, but go soft just before insertion... my wife has been understanding, but it has been frustrating. My Doctor said that erection problems are more common than people think - especially for people over 40 and she could prescribe a generic 'Cialis' if need be but I was too embarrassed to take up the offer.I understand that it takes about 30 minutes for 'things to happen' after taking a dose of Cialis. - is this correct?? what are peoples experiences with this?Also are their any side effects from taking Cialis or Viagra?I'm on oral medication and insulin for my diabetes - would Cialis mess with my diabetes  or vice versa?I am interested to hear about other peoples experiences with Cialis / Viagra
title: Viagra / Cialis - how long does it last and any side effects?
